page.title: 19FARMING IN HEAGE
page.content: Little change in land utilization has taken place. Arable-Lodge Farm has 150 acres.Barley is the main crop.Wheat 25 acres.Peas 25 acres. Dairy-West Bank Farm 86 acres.Family worked.50 Dairy cattle,20 beef cattle, 20 goats,8 sheep,3 horses,2ploughed fields.Milk is bottled on the farm for sale.Goats provide milk and cheese for sale on the round. Manor Farm-101 acres.Worked by the family plus one employee.Built in 1860 for the Iron Works Manager.60 cattle, 48 in milk producing 5,000 litres per day.2 Ayrshire,Holstiens and Jerseys.Milk is bottled and sold locally along with orange juice, yoghurt and cheese.They keep three dogs,1 horse,28 pigs. Brook Farm-Sheep on Dungely hillside.
